This filter predicate tests which elements of the source to add whenever a is received. A reset is forwarded by clearing the completely and re-filling it with the source's values, and this predicate determines which ones are added. If no filter predicate is provided, all source values will be re-added to the .
if set to true only distinct values will be re-added on changes.
The value equality comparer to use for reset changes and if is set to [true]. If none is provided, the default one for the value type will be used
member.returns: An which will forward the changes to the as long as hasn't been called.

member.name: M:JB.Collections.Reactive.ObservableList`1.Move(`0,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the specified item to the new index position.
member.param: The item.
The new index.

if set to true the will be adjusted, if required, depending on whether an index shift took place during the move due to the original position of the item. Basically if you move an item from a lower index position to a higher one, the index positions of all items with higher index positions than the ones will be shifted upwards (logically by -1). Depending on whether the caller intends to move the item strictly or logically to the position, correction might be useful.
